shows.title: The Fawning Response / Emotions & Spiritual Guidance
shows.first_half: First Half: Clinical psychologist Dr. Ingrid Clayton will discuss the relational trauma response known as fawning, a phenomenon where one responds to a threat by "becoming more appealing to the threat" and mirroring or merging with someone else's desires or expectations.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Filmmaker and documentary director Kristin Gillespie will discuss her work and research regarding human emotion as the blueprint for intelligent design. She believes your unique emotions provide unparalleled guidance, uncovering information about your soul’s mission.

shows.title: Finding Peace in Prison / Prophecy & Spiritual Warfare
shows.guests: Douglas E. Noll, Michael H. Brown
shows.first_half: First Half: Author, instructor, and mediator Douglas E. Noll will present his work resolving people's deep interpersonal and ideological conflicts, as well as teaching life inmates at maximum-security prisons to be peacemakers. Noll will also give his critique of America's incarceration system.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Founder of the spiritual news website Spirit Daily, Michael H. Brown, will discuss prophecy, world and Church events, the eruption of paranormal phenomena, and spiritual warfare.

shows.title: The Pope & Numerology / Dinosaurs & Dragons
shows.first_half: First Half: Numerologist Glynis McCants will use her skills to give us deeper insight into the year 2025 and what we can expect as we move forward. She will share some fascinating numerology connections between the last two Popes and the new one, Pope Leo XIV. She will also do number readings for callers starting at 11pm Pacific Time.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Teacher and Orthodox Christian theologist Philip Senter will bring us his research into the science of fossils and the truth about dinosaurs and dragons. He will also discuss his conclusions on creationism versus science.

shows.title: Evidence of Life After Death / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Author and researcher Sandra Champlain joins our new guest host Ryan Wrecker to discuss what she considers overwhelming evidence for life after death. She will draw from her years of investigating hundreds of near-death experiences and talk about her exploration of Electronic Voice Phenomena (EVP), mediumship, death-bed visitations, induced after-death communication, and more. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half.
